item.title: How to: Basic buffer overflows without stack protections
item.description:
Kind of starting a little basic, but what is a buffer overflow? Effectively, when the program is expecting a certain amount of data to be written, and more data than that gets written, overflowing the buffer. When done on the stack (the most basic case), this is often called stack smashing (likely popularized by the amazing stack canary message “**** stack smashing detected ****”).

For instance, if our memory looks something like below:
